actions.name: JSONPath Query
actions.title: JSONPath Query - Grab data from Webhook

properties.display_name: JSONPath Query - Grab data from Webhook

properties.script:
from datetime import datetime
import argparse
import sys
import string
# datetime object containing current date and time

date_http = sys.argv[1];
sub_date_http = date_http[0:24]

date = datetime.strptime(sub_date_http, '%a %b %d %H:%M:%S %Y')
print (date.isoformat()+"Z")

#Convert time to ISO Format 2022-03-28T06:52:02Z
date_iso = date.isoformat()+"Z" 

#Gather hour from current time 
data_hour = int (date_iso[11:13]) 

#Gather date + hour ISO Format 2022-03-28T06
parcial_date_h = date_iso[0:13]

#Gather month + day + hour ISO Format -03-28T06
parcial_day_month_h = date_iso[4:13]

#Gather date + hour ISO Format 2022
year = date_iso[0:4]
year_bef = int(year) - 1

import math
import sys

source = sys.argv[1];
number = float(source)
rounded_number = math.ceil(number)

print(rounded_number)

import sys

email_list = []

result = sys.argv[1];
email_list= result.split(' ')

# Count the entries in the list
total_count = len(email_list)

# Count the entries in the list
total_count = len(email_list)

# Count the occurrences of each domain in the list and store them in a dictionary
domain_count = {}
for email in email_list:
    domain = email.split('@')[-1]
    if domain in domain_count:
        domain_count[domain] += 1
    else:
        domain_count[domain] = 1

# Sort the domain counts in descending order
sorted_domains = sorted(domain_count.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True)

# Remove duplicated entries and create a new list with one entry per domain
unique_domains = []
seen_domains = set()
for email in email_list:
    domain = email.split('@')[-1]
    if domain not in seen_domains:
        seen_domains.add(domain)
        unique_domains.append(email)

# Sort the unique domains based on their counts (largest to smallest)
unique_domains.sort(key=lambda x: domain_count[x.split('@')[-1]], reverse=True)


# Generate the output text
output_text = f"Total count: {total_count}\n"
output_text += "\nTop 10 domains:\n"
top_10_domains = sorted_domains[:10]
for i, (domain, count) in enumerate(top_10_domains, start=1):
    output_text += f"{i}. {domain} (Count: {count})\n"
output_text += "\nFull Address List:\n"
for email in unique_domains:
    domain = email.split('@')[-1]
    domain_occurrences = domain_count[domain]
    output_text += f"{email} (Count: {domain_occurrences})\n"
